page.title: 08Changing times
page.content: Tuesday May 24th, an interview with the oldest inhabitant of Hartington, 90 yr old Miss Palfreyman. Ninety years ago there was not a lot of money about. Toys were scarce with most being made by parents. Whip and tops were a favourite,they painted them brightly, she recalls a friend sending his top through a ladies window. Hartington School had 70 children on roll. The school has changed since then with 2 new extensions built on inrecent years. A white horse named Harriet brought groceries long ago from nearby Warslow. During the 2nd world war a bomb fell by the church, thankfully no great damage was done. Mrs Palfreyman worked at the cheese factory during the war when there were only 5 staff. In coronation year, 1953 the village celebrated with a dinner at school.
